revised_title: Spectral Analysis of Gases and Vapors
tldr: The authors describe their experiments on the spectra of ignited gases and vapors, using electric discharges and spectral tubes to analyze the light emitted by various substances. They discuss the advantages and limitations of different methods, and present their findings on the spectra of elements such as hydrogen, nitrogen, and carbon. Their work contributes to the understanding of the properties of gases and vapors, and the behavior of matter under different conditions.
